description.zh-cn: 中国民主革命家，中华民国及中华人民共和国军事及政治人物，武昌起义的主要领导人之一。
description.en: A Chinese democratic revolutionary, military and political figure in the Republic of China and the People's Republic of China, and one of the main leaders of the Wuchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 清代湖北省武昌府下辖县，为熊秉坤的出生地。
description.en: A county under Wuchang Prefecture, Hubei Province during the Qing Dynasty, and the birthplace of Xiong Bingkun.

description.zh-cn: 湖北省省会，熊秉坤晚年居住地及逝世地。
description.en: The capital of Hubei Province, where Xiong Bingkun spent his later years and passed away.

description.zh-cn: 清末新军的全国三十六镇之一，驻扎湖北。熊秉坤曾在此当兵，其下属的工程第八营是武昌起义主力。
description.en: One of the 36 divisions of the New Army in the late Qing Dynasty, stationed in Hubei. Xiong Bingkun served here, and its 8th Engineer Battalion was the main force of the Wuchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 清末在长江中游地区活动的革命团体，是策动武昌起义的主要组织之一。
description.en: A revolutionary group active in the middle reaches of the Yangtze River in the late Qing Dynasty, one of the main organizations that instigated the Wuchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命的开端，熊秉坤是此次起义的领导人之一，他率部占领了楚望台军械库。
description.en: The beginning of the Xinhai Revolution. Xiong Bingkun was one of the leaders of this uprising, leading his troops to capture the Chuwangtai Armory.

description.zh-cn: 湖北新军工程第八营士兵，因枪杀长官而直接引发了武昌起义。
description.en: A soldier of the 8th Engineer Battalion of the Hubei New Army whose shooting of his officer directly triggered the Wuchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事人物，武昌起义后被熊秉坤等人推举为湖北革命军临时总指挥。
description.en: A military figure of the Republic of China, he was acclaimed as the temporary commander-in-chief of the Hubei Revolutionary Army by Xiong Bingkun and others after the Wuchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国第一任正式大总统。他曾授予熊秉坤勋章，但后来熊秉坤参加了反对其统治的“二次革命”。
description.en: The first formal President of the Republic of China. He awarded a medal to Xiong Bingkun, but Xiong later participated in the 'Second Revolution' against his rule.

description.zh-cn: 1913年孙中山及国民党人为反对袁世凯独裁而发动的战争，熊秉坤参与其中。
description.en: A war launched in 1913 by Sun Yat-sen and the Kuomintang against Yuan Shikai's dictatorship, in which Xiong Bingkun participated.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国第一任副总统和第二任大总统。在二次革命失败后，他曾悬赏通缉熊秉坤。
description.en: The first Vice President and second President of the Republic of China. After the failure of the Second Revolution, he put a bounty on Xiong Bingkun.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命的伟大先行者，中华民国和中国国民党的缔造者。他曾任命熊秉坤为讨袁鄂军司令，熊秉坤也曾在其领导的广州大元帅府任职。
description.en: A great pioneer of modern Chinese democratic revolution, and the founder of the Republic of China and the Kuomintang. He appointed Xiong Bingkun as the commander of the Hubei army against Yuan Shikai, and Xiong also served in the Guangzhou Grand Marshal's Mansion under his leadership.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。二七大罢工期间，熊秉坤曾将自己家提供给中共作为临时会议地点。
description.en: The ruling party of the People's Republic of China. During the February 7th Strike, Xiong Bingkun provided his home as a temporary meeting place for the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末代皇帝，也是中国的末代皇帝。1961年在纪念辛亥革命50周年活动期间与熊秉坤会面。
description.en: The last emperor of the Qing dynasty and the last emperor of China. He met with Xiong Bingkun in 1961 during the 50th-anniversary commemoration of the Xinhai Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国第一任国务院总理。他曾安排熊秉坤与溥仪会面，并在熊秉坤去世后亲自指示安排其后事。
description.en: The first Premier of the People's Republic of China. He arranged the meeting between Xiong Bingkun and Puyi, and personally gave instructions for Xiong's funeral arrangements after his death.

description.zh-cn: 由毛泽东发动和领导的政治运动。期间，熊秉坤家曾被红卫兵抄家。
description.en: A political movement initiated and led by Mao Zedong. During this period, Xiong Bingkun's home was raided by Red Guards.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间湖北省的权力机构。在周恩来指示下，该委员会为熊秉坤操办了丧事。
description.en: The organ of power in Hubei Province during the Cultural Revolution. Under Zhou Enlai's instructions, this committee handled Xiong Bingkun's funeral.

position.en: Section Leader of the 8th Engineer Battalion

description.zh-cn: 熊秉坤入湖北陆军第八镇工程第八营当兵，后升为正目（相当于班长）。
description.en: Xiong Bingkun joined the 8th Engineer Battalion of the Hubei Eighth Army Division as a soldier and was later promoted to Section Leader (equivalent to a squad leader).

description.zh-cn: 作为工程营革命军大队长，在起义中首先率部占领了楚望台军械库，是起义的主要领导人之一。
description.en: As the captain of the revolutionary forces in the engineering battalion, he was one of the main leaders of the uprising, leading his troops to capture the Chuwangtai Armory first.

description.zh-cn: 程正瀛在与长官冲突中开枪，直接点燃了武昌起义的导火索。
description.en: Cheng Zhengying's shooting during a conflict with his officer directly ignited the Wuchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 武昌起义爆发后，熊秉坤等人推举队官吴兆麟担任湖北革命军临时总指挥。
description.en: After the outbreak of the Wuchang Uprising, Xiong Bingkun and others acclaimed company officer Wu Zhaolin as the temporary commander-in-chief of the Hubei Revolutionary Army.

description.zh-cn: 熊秉坤参加了反对袁世凯的“二次革命”，并组织改进团，出任鄂中司令。
description.en: Xiong Bingkun participated in the 'Second Revolution' against Yuan Shikai, organized a reform group, and served as the commander of central Hubei.

description.zh-cn: 熊秉坤参加了旨在推翻袁世凯统治的二次革命。
description.en: Xiong Bingkun participated in the Second Revolution, which aimed to overthrow Yuan Shikai's rule.

description.zh-cn: 二次革命失败后，黎元洪悬赏通缉熊秉坤，导致其流亡日本。
description.en: After the failure of the Second Revolution, Li Yuanhong put a bounty on Xiong Bingkun, causing him to flee to Japan.

position.zh-cn: 广州大元帅府参军、高级副官、代参军长
position.en: Military Counselor, Senior Adjutant, and Acting Chief Military Counselor of the Guangzhou Grand Marshal's Mansion

description.zh-cn: 护法运动爆发后，熊秉坤在孙中山领导的广州大元帅府任职。
description.en: After the outbreak of the Constitutional Protection Movement, Xiong Bingkun served in the Guangzhou Grand Marshal's Mansion led by Sun Yat-sen.

description.zh-cn: 二七大罢工期间，因中共原会议地点暴露，熊秉坤将自己家提供为临时会场，帮助会议得以继续召开。
description.en: During the February 7th Strike, after the original CCP meeting place was compromised, Xiong Bingkun provided his home as a temporary venue, helping the meeting to continue.

description.zh-cn: 1961年在北京参加辛亥革命50周年纪念活动期间，经周恩来安排，熊秉坤与溥仪会见。
description.en: In 1961, during the 50th-anniversary commemoration of the Xinhai Revolution in Beijing, Xiong Bingkun met with Puyi, arranged by Zhou Enlai.

description.zh-cn: 1964年，熊秉坤作为全国政协委员在北京开会，在国宴上同周恩来交谈。
description.en: In 1964, as a member of the National Committee of the CPPCC, Xiong Bingkun attended a meeting in Beijing and talked with Zhou Enlai at a state banquet.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命期间，红卫兵曾到熊秉坤家抄家。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Red Guards raided Xiong Bingkun's home.

description.zh-cn: 熊秉坤去世后，周恩来作出指示，要求湖北省革命委员会为熊秉坤操办丧事。
description.en: After Xiong Bingkun's death, Zhou Enlai gave instructions requesting the Hubei Provincial Revolutionary Committee to handle his funeral.
